Class Deck

  • java.lang.Object
    • Deck

  • public class Deck
extends java.lang.Object
    The Class Deck represents a standard playing card deck of 52 cards.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Deck()
      Instantiates a new deck with the standard 52 cards

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Card cutDeck(int min, int max)
      Cut deck, returning a card
      Card dealCard()
      Deals the card on top of the deck, removing it from the deck
      void dealCards(Player[] players, int handSize)
      Deals cards, one at a time, to each player
      java.util.Stack<Card> getDeck()
      Gets the deck.
      boolean isEmpty()
      Checks if is empty.
      void printDeck()
      Prints each card in the deck in rows of 13
      void shuffle()
      Shuffles the deck
      int size()
      Size.

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • cutDeck

        public Card cutDeck(int min,
                    int max)
        Cut deck, returning a card
        Parameters:
        min - the minimum numbers of cards to be cut off the top of the deck
        max - the maximum number of cards to be cut off the top of the deck
        Returns:
        the card returned from the cut

      • dealCard

        public Card dealCard()
        Deals the card on top of the deck, removing it from the deck
        Returns:
        the card from the top of the deck

      • dealCards

        public void dealCards(Player[] players,
                      int handSize)
        Deals cards, one at a time, to each player
        Parameters:
        players - the players receiving the cards
        handSize - the amount of cards being dealt to each player

      • isEmpty
